No mathematical equations have changed our lives as much as Maxwell's. âˆ¯ The stories of discoveries of fundamental theories are quite fascinating and instructive. //A bit of history Maxwell began to formulate the dynamic theory of electricity in 1860. His initial motivation was to develop the laws of electricity in a unified form using the new mathematics. When he began this work, the equations kept turning out to be incomplete. Only by 1864 did he dare to add one more term (displacement current), which was justified only by mathematical beauty. The consequence of Maxwell's equations was an electromagnetic wave. Although today we study this at school, scientists of that time have never seen anything like it. After publishing this article, Maxwell came under heavy fire from his peers. Fate was unfair to Maxwell. He passed away without knowing that he had described all the possible properties of electricity and had built a theory of light. These conclusions were made by Hertz a few years after Maxwell's death. His equations stood the test of time. //What's in it for us? All electronics and radio transmission are based on Maxwell's equations. Economists estimate the contribution of these equations as 40-50% of the entire world economy. A hunch on mathematical beauty is a foundation of a half of our economy! We are on the verge of multiple advancement in neuroscience, synthetic biology, materials and energy just to name few. Deep Tech VCs can help these advancements come to life. Let's make sure we invest in the best teams: those with both entrepreneurial and scientific competence. #science #history #physics #deeptech Tamaz Khunjua
